titleStmt.title: The fox too cunning for the lyon. Or, The foxes feast, wherein is exprest many a witty but most true jest, both old and young of it take a view, and by experience you'l say it's true. To the tune of, The Three cheators.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Charles Tytus on London Bridge.,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "A den of foxes on a day ..."
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
